meanings.definition: Something that is similar or comparable to something else.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the characters were described as analogs of famous historical figures.
meanings.sent2: The relationship between a teacher and a student can be seen as an analog of a parent and child.
meanings.sent3: The analogy between the two friends being like analogs of each other made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was an analog for her passion for nurturing relationships.
meanings.sent5: The artist used colors as analogs to express different emotions in the painting.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound that is structurally similar to another compound.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are studying the analogs of the new drug to understand its effects better.
meanings.sent2: The pharmaceutical company developed analogs of the original medication to improve its efficacy.
meanings.sent3: The lab assistant accidentally mixed up the analogs, creating a funny reaction.
meanings.sent4: The chemist compared the two compounds, highlighting the analogs in their molecular structures.
meanings.sent5: The researcher synthesized analogs of the substance to test their properties in the experiment.

meanings.definition: A device or system that performs a similar function to another device or system.
meanings.sent1: The new smartphone model is considered an analog of the previous version with upgraded features.
meanings.sent2: An analog of the traditional thermostat, the smart thermostat adjusts the temperature automatically.
meanings.sent3: The robotic vacuum cleaner behaved like an analog of a pet, following its owner around the house.
meanings.sent4: The smartwatch serves as an analog to a personal assistant, providing reminders and notifications.
meanings.sent5: The analog of the old radio was a modern streaming device with internet connectivity.
